channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rachel Reeves targets UK’s wealthiest in £26bn tax-raising budget
item.description: Chancellor axes two-child benefit cap and cuts energy bills paid for by mansion tax and freezing tax thresholds Analysis: ‘Tax-raising budget crash-la...

item.title: Washington DC shooting: two national guard members shot near White House have died, West Virginia governor says - latest updates
item.description: Both were in West Virginia National Guard, governor Patrick Morrisey said in X post; suspect is in custody, according to Washington DC police Two West...

item.title: Hong Kong fire: three reportedly arrested with dozens dead and hundreds missing in housing complex blaze – follow updates
item.description: At least 36 killed and hundreds missing after huge blaze at the Wang Fuk Court residential complex in Tai Po district on Wednesday. Follow the latest ...

item.title: Australia politics live: speculation grows over Barnaby Joyce defection to One Nation; AI ‘nudify’ service blocks Australians
item.description: Former Nationals leader could announce his decision to quit as early as today, reports claim. Follow today’s news live Get our breaking news email , f...

item.title: Two West Virginia national guard members killed in Washington DC
item.description: The two national guard members were shot near Farragut West metro station, and police said one suspect is in custody US politics live – latest updates...

item.title: Extra time for peers to debate assisted dying
item.description: The assisted dying bill is allocated further sessions after a record number of amendments in the House of Lords.

item.title: Key measures from this year's Budget at-a-glance
item.description: Changes to tax, pensions and welfare - here’s what you need to know from Rachel Reevesher second Budget.

item.title: Owners of properties worth more than £2m in England face 'mansion tax'
item.description: The surcharge begins at £2,500, rising to £7,500 for properties valued at more than £5m.

item.title: We make £100,000. The cut to cash Isa limit is a big blow
item.description: BBC News hears from people with a range of incomes about what they think of the Budget.

item.title: Georgia judge dismisses 2020 election interference case against Trump
item.description: The state charges were the last remaining criminal case against the US president stemming from the 2020 election.
